admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact is substantial. The experiences and
            lessons learned from the project can be summarized as the
            follows. High turnover within the project implementation
            unit (PIU) and staff shortage towards the end of the
            project, affected project management. This was because the
            staff were hired on a temporary basis, and scheduled to
            leave by the end of the loan process, whereas the
            disbursement process and evaluation report preparation
            remained for four months after the loan closing date. These
            problems could be solved by assigning more government
            officers to work at the PIU. Nevertheless, effective
            inspections of project outputs were an important factor to
            ensure the quality of each sub-project. Under this project,
            each project steering committee examined the deliverables
            carefully, and would not approve the outputs unless project
            objectives were met, as well as all of the requirements
            stated in the terms of reference (TORs). Lastly, this
            project can be regarded as a good practice for executing a
            technical assistance project.
